subject: AW: [junit] Ordered execution of test cases
msgSnippet: ... You are right that the tests *happen* to be executed in the order they are added to the suite. But I don t think that it is the *required* (specified)
messageBody:
> It's possible to explicitly define the test method order in
> the suite() method, as in...
>
> public static Test suite() {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> suite.addTest(new ExampleTestCase("testA"));
> suite.addTest(new ExampleTestCase("testB"));
> suite.addTest(new ExampleTestCase("testC"));
> return suite;
> }

You are right that the tests *happen* to be executed in the order they are
added to the suite. But I don't think that it is the *required* (specified)
behaviour of a suite. Howsoever, I would try hardly to get my tests to be
independent of each other!

ciao, Ilja
